body:
BTS Reactions - You see your estranged parent

When you shut the door to your apartment, you fall flat against it, heart palpitating unhealthily. You’d seen your mother on the way home from work, and you didn’t know what to do. You’ve never been particularly close, and you haven’t spoken to her in a few years since that fight you had. She’d made eye contact with you and just… looked away. You may not get along, but that hurt.

Your boyfriend sees you in the doorway looking quite pale, and when he asks you don’t hesitate to tell him what happened, trying your best not to cry.

Jimin

Jimin hurries to wrap you up in his arms, the smallest little frown etched on his forehead. At the time that you and your mother fought, Jimin didn’t know what to do. He didn’t want to badmouth any of your family, but he definitely did in his head. It broke you, and by extension it broke him. He can’t even begin to imagine how it must feel to have your own mother pretend that you don’t exist,

“You don’t need her,” Jimin tells you firmly, rubbing your back before helping you remove your jacket, “You’ve gone years without needing her, and you don’t need her now. You have a family of your own right here, and this family will always love and support you,” He assures you, and you nod vaguely. Jimin smiles sadly and takes your hand in both of his, squeezing it encouragingly.

Taehyung

Taehyung remembers the fight you had that broke your relationship with your mother pretty much beyond repair. It had been the most awful thing he’d ever seen, especially as someone who values family so dearly. Seeing yours torn apart like that hurt him, although not as nearly as much as it hurt you. It was painful to watch, but more painful for you to feel, and Taehyung knows some of that hollow pain is making itself known again,

“Hey, you’re home now,” Taehyung coos, pulling you into his chest, “You’re home now, and you have nothing to worry about. You’re so strong, you have no idea how much I admire you. You shouldn’t have to be the bigger person here, but you are, and I’m proud of you for it,” He tells you, politely ignoring the way you shoulders shake with tears.

Jungkook

When the tension between you and your mother reached breaking point and you encouraged Jungkook to share his opinion, he held back a bit. He didn’t want to seem disrespectful, but it’s incidents like this that really make him reconsider the way he speaks. Maybe he should’ve told you to try and distance yourself before it was too late, and then things like this wouldn’t hurt so bad. For now, all Jungkook can do is comfort you,

“Don’t even think about her. She should’ve been there for you, but she’s not. Don’t let it get to you when you have a perfect life without her. You shouldn’t have to put up with such toxicity,” Jungkook urges. That’s as rude as he’ll get when speaking of your family, but you appreciate it. You lean up to place a sweet kiss to his lips, and Jungkook smiles down at you, reconnecting your lips again and again until your mind is clear.

title: motel’97 - 17
body:
➵ pairing: jungkook x reader  
➵ genre: mafia au, angst, fluff, smut.
➵ warning: violence, crude language, read at own risk.
➵ word count: 4.3K+

➵  previous chapter - next chapter

The next hour or so was spent tangled in the sheets in pure euphoria as the moon shone through the semi-transparent curtains in the room.The following morning was sure to be interesting.

Picking up his cellphone after thinking and planning every and any outcome for what seemed to be hours, he decided to finally put the plan he decided was best into action. He knew he would agree with him in the end if he played his cards right, and the plan itself was sensible, but he knew for a fact you wouldn’t believe that and defy him at any costs.

Ring.. Ring..

“Hello..?” Jungkook’s raspy voice answered the phone. Upon hearing the vibrations against the nightstand, he quickly reached over, reading the caller ID and hitting answer. He quickly yanked the sheets off his body, searched the floor for his sweatpants, dragging them up over his waist and disappearing into the hallway, being careful to not wake you in the process.

“Hey.. You up?” Namjoon asked as he twirled around in his desk chair. “I am now..” Jungkook mumbled as he made a B-line for the kitchen downstairs. 

“Why..” Jungkook questioned, suddenly becoming more alert to the fact that it was indeed Namjoon calling and nothing good would probably arise from it. “It’s Yoongi.. He’s… active again.” Namjoon breathed out. “It’s soon.. We’re running out of time..” Namjoon explained.

As soon as the words left his mouth, it was only followed by silence. For a moment, Namjoon had thought the call ended abruptly, but once he heard Jungkook draw in a breath, he braced himself for Jungkook’s wrath. 

“So what does this mean? Cut the bullshit and tell me straight up.” Jungkook’s body stilled as he awaited Namjoon’s explanation. “Well… This kinda segways into another thing I called for.. It’s about Y/N… She- ”

“No. Absolutely not. I don’t know what it is or what you want but no. She’s not getting involved again.” Jungkook cursed over the phone. Did he really think he’d agree to subjecting you to anything else after everything you’d just been through?

Namjoon clicked his tongue and leaned forward on his desk, phone still in hand. “Can you at least give me a damn chance to explain myself?” Namjoon sighed, annoyed. Namjoon knew Jungkook would immediately shut the idea down, but he still tried to argue his way in.

Seeing as Jungkook didn’t interrupt or say anything else in protest, Namjoon figured this was his chance to explain. Drawing a breath in, he began to explain. “She needs training.” Namjoon appealed. 

“For?” Jungkook quickly hissed. “Is that even a question?” Namjoon barked. “Take a damn look at her kid. She’s tiny, frail, and weak. She’s no match for any of the shit that gets thrown at her for being with you.” Namjoon objected. Jungkook felt a pang of guilt in his chest as he registered Namjoon’s words.

Silence followed for a few moments before Jungkook gave in. “Who.. would train her?” Jungkook hesitated. The idea of someone back at base training you was out of the question considering Jungkook himself could barely handle it. 

“You will. She’s yours so why wouldn’t you?” Namjoon assured. “Plus I’m not trying to deal with you beating the shit out of someone every time they lay a damn hand on her even though that’s clearly implied with training..” Namjoon lectured.

Jungkook paused, leaning over to rest his elbows on the kitchen counter. The idea itself really wasn’t bad. Jungkook of all people knew that first hand, having seen the things that happened to you because he wasn’t there to protect you. He ran his hand through his messy hair, before deciding and answering Namjoon.

“Okay.. I’ll do it. But.. why now?” Jungkook wondered. Namjoon took a deep breath in before responding. “Yoongi. We know he has a weak spot for her and we can use that..” Namjoon explained slowly and carefully. 

“Of course..” Jungkook growled over the phone. He knew it would end up like this one way or another. 

Namjoon didn’t give a damn about you or your safety, he only saw you as a pawn.. Something he could use and then discard. Not caring for what happens to you in the process..  

“She’s not getting involved in this again Namjoon. She just barely made it out and she’s in no condition to go anywhere back into it.” Jungkook fumed. Namjoon clutched his phone tighter in his hand, becoming more annoyed and angry by the minute.

 “She’s already involved Jungkook. Open your damn eyes. It’s too late to play the savior. At least my option gives her a chance to survive and learn some shit about this life.” Namjoon progressively began to get more and more heated.

“You can’t keep shielding her from it. Have her join and be able to fight back, because whether you like it or not, she’s already in and there’s no way of her getting out.” Namjoon shouted over the phone. 

Jungkook frowned, knowing part of what he said was true. You were already involved and there wasn’t any way out. Or at least any way that didn’t end up with you being dead.

Jungkook stayed silent, unsure of what to do or say. “Come on kid. You know I’m right. Give her a chance to survive in this mess. Because we both know she’s not getting out.” Namjoon pled. “…Okay. I’ll do it. But I get to call the shot for when she’s ready..” Jungkook’s voice faltered. 

“I swear to god Namjoon.. If she gets hurt in any way.. I’ll kill you myself.” Jungkook seethed. “Good choice kid. I’ll call you again at the end of the week. Start training her right away. The sooner the better..” Namjoon stood from his desk, getting ready to call in for a meeting on the new plan. 

“Good luck.. Don’t forget you’re doing this for her..” Namjoon asserted before hanging up abruptly.

Jungkook let out an audible sigh and tossed his phone over onto the couch, not wanting to think at the moment. Was he really doing the right thing..? He questioned himself as he walked around the other side of the counter towards the fridge. 

How was he going to explain to you? What would you say or do? Jungkook ran his hands through his hair once more trying to settle his nerves as he began to make breakfast for you two, deciding that would be the best time to break the news..

You stirred around a few times, groaning as you slowly began to wake up. The light coming through the curtains was bright enough to cause you to rub at your eyes, shielding them from the sensitive rays. 

“Shit..” You mumbled as you began to come to your senses. You pried your eyes open, taking in your surroundings and position when you realized what had just happened. You slept with Jungkook.

Your face instantly became a shade of deep red as you frantically searched the floor for your clothes, feeling vulnerable all alone in the sheets.

 Sliding out of bed, placing your feet on the cold floor, you noticed just how sore your legs became as you walked over to the dresser. Noticing one of the drawers was slightly open, you decided you’d just change from whatever was in there.

Pulling a plain white shirt over your head and changing into underwear, you decided you looked decent enough, considering it was still early morning and you weren’t planning to go anywhere anytime soon. 

Only then, as you ran your hands through your hair in an attempt to smooth the frizzy hairs, you realized Jungkook wasn’t anywhere to be seen.

You furrowed your brows and quickly moved over to his side of the bed to see his phone was gone along with his sweatpants. 

Thinking maybe he just went to the bathroom, you began to make your way towards the door to the hallway, when the smell of eggs and bacon hit your nose.

Making your way down the hallway to the stairs, the aroma of the fresh food became stronger. Figuring it was Jungkook, you tried to quickly make your way down the stairs, but failed as your legs felt like jelly. Your face became another shade of light red as your mind kept wandering back to why and how your legs came to be in the state they are.

Once you made it down the stairs, you began to head to the kitchen where you came into view of his back facing you as he stood in front of the stove. You let a small smile form on your face, imagining all the mornings you two would share like this.. Making breakfast together, enjoying coffee and such.. Minus the pain in the legs..

You slowly made your way over to him, trying your best to not make any noise and surprise him, but he was quicker than you. “If you wanna sneak up on someone you’ve got to be more quiet than that.” He snickered as you wrapped your arms around his bare torso from behind.

“I tried my best, it’s not exactly easy to walk anymore, thanks to you..” You giggled as you smacked his back. 

Walking around to the other side of the counter, you pulled a chair out and watched as he finished up the eggs. Jungkook just smirked as he turned around, placing the last of the food he made onto the plates.

“Well you asked for it..” He chuckled as you hid your face in your hands as you sat at the table. “Let’s just say it was a team effort..” You mumbled as he came to join you at the table, setting down your plate in front of you. “Whatever you sayyyy…” Jungkook trailed along as he sat down opposite of you.

You two both sat and enjoyed your food as you made small talk, until Jungkook cleared his throat catching your attention. “Hmm?” You questioned as you looked up at him, placing your fork down. 

“So.. I wanted to talk to you about something..” Jungkook informed as he set down his utensils as well. You scanned his face for any clues but all you were met with was a serious, yet somewhat comforting stare.

“Okay..? What..?” You questioned, shifting your legs to lean over on the table. “It’s about Namjoon… “ He began, and you immediately frowned, fearing the worst. 

“He wants you to train and join..” Jungkook said placing his hands flat on the table. “What?!” You immediately choked up. “Look I know it’s-” “No! No Jungkook I can’t!” You quickly retaliated, standing from your chair.

“Y/N babe listen to me, I will train you myself and i’ll make sure you’re with me the whole time..” Jungkook explained as he stood from his chair, walking over to comfort you. 

You stood bewildered, staring at the floor empty. “I can’t do that Jungkook.. I can’t do this..” Your heart began to race at even the mere thought of it.

“Listen.. I know it’s a lot to take in but I won’t let anyone hurt you Y/N. This is for the best.. You have to trust me..” Jungkook cupped your face in his hands, causing you to look up at him. 

“I want you to be safe and be able to protect yourself if anything happens to me..” Jungkook carrassed your face, tucking a small strand of hair behind your ear.

“Jungkook I can’t.. I’m not strong enough.. I can’t do this.. I’m not you.. I’m not like you..” Your eyes began to tear up. Jungkook’s heart ached. “Look.. I know it’s scary.. But I’ll be with you the whole time. I’ll train you myself. It’s all gonna be okay..” Jungkook pressed a kiss to your forehead as he pulled you into his chest. 

“You have to trust me.. You know I wouldn’t be doing this if it wasn’t for the best.” Jungkook softly whispered into your ear. You pressed your face further into Jungkook’s chest, wiping your tears away with your free hand.

“I’m scared..” You admitted. “I know. But I won’t let anything happen to you. Okay..?” Jungkook gripped your shoulders, pulling you back to view your face. “Okay..” You breathed out. 

Jungkook let a small smile form as he pulled you back into him. Okay… It’s all gonna be okay.. He won’t let anything happen..

-  2 weeks later   -

“Fuck!” You yelled out as your back hit the mat once again. “You keep dropping your shoulder too low Y/N.. You need to react faster than that..” Jungkook explained as he landed on top of you, with your arm pulled back. 

“I’m fucking trying Jungkook.. Maybe if this wasn’t so rushed I could learn properly..” You snapped back at him as you stood, brushing off your arms. 

You had been thrown down on the mat a good 6 times in a row now, not understanding the mistake being made. Namjoon had called back last week informing Jungkook that we had 2 weeks left to train before they had to bring you into base.

“I know it’s hard.. But this is the only way you’ll get better.” Jungkook explained as he walked over behind you. “Look, you have your shoulder here by the time I’m already within reach. It needs to be here, so you can reach my arm and then flip.” Jungkook instructed as he placed his hands on your shoulder, turning your body. 

“Try it from that angle next time.” Jungkook patted your back as he moved to stand in front of you.

             “Alright..” You breathed out, rolling your shoulders back. “I’m ready.” You announced. Jungkook nodded, giving a countdown. “Alright… 3..2..” He breathed out as he then ran at you, pulling the same move as last time. 

Remembering the tip Jungkook gave you, you moved your shoulder to the right instead, grabbing Jungkook’s arm and twisting it to pull him around. 

Thinking you finally did it and had the upperhand, you began to ease into it, until Jungkook thrashed and turned his body, landing a strike to your jaw. Of course it didn’t hurt really bad, but still enough to piss you off even more.

“The hell was that?!” You huffed, shoving him away from you. “You let your guard down.” He simply responded. “Never let your guard down until the enemy is down or dead.” He clarified. You just glared at him from your spot on the floor. 

“Take 5 and then we’ll start weapon combat instead.” Jungkook explained as he walked over to the wall, grabbing his water bottle. You pushed yourself up off the floor and out of the room to the bathroom, letting the door slam behind you.

Standing in front of the mirror, you cupped some cold water from the sink and splashed it on your face. Letting the water droplets run off and fall back into the sink. Your face was red and sweaty in defeat. 

Grabbing one of the small towels from the rack, you wiped at your face, wiping away the small hair strands that had stuck to your face in the process.

 “Shit..” You mumbled as you turned to see a small purple bruise forming on your jaw from where Jungkook struck you. You really wished at times like these you would’ve just said no and stuck with it.

          Walking back into the large practice room, you saw Jungkook leaned up against the wall, phone in hand, typing away. You just scoffed and proceeded to place your belongings back onto the floor and stand in the middle of the room. However, you noticed Jungkook pulled out a small cart with all sorts of pocket knives and sharp weapons. 

“You done…?” You sarcastically commented as he looked up from his phone before hitting the screen once more and pocketing it. “Yeah, sorry.” He dismissed as he wheeled the cart over towards you.

         “Pick one.” He abruptly commented as the cart came to a stop. “This again?” You dreaded. Last time you failed miserably and left with all sorts of small cuts and lacerations. 

Jungkook was ruthless during training but afterwards always seemed to make it up and baby you. You wondered why he even bothered to go so hard in the first place.

        “Yeah. You need to get better. This is gonna be the majority of what you run into out there.” Jungkook explained as he picked up a decent sized dagger. You scoffer once more, picking up a similar weapon before kicking the cart to the side. “Alright, let’s try the chokehold again.” Jungkook announced. You immediately frowned.

            “Really..? Don’t you think we did that enough? You know I suck Jungkook.” You pulled down the collar of your shirt, revealing all sorts of small cuts along your collarbones and base of your neck.

 “That’s why we need to train and keep working on it Y/N…” Jungkook whined and tossed his head back, having had this conversation plenty times before. “Just follow my lead again..”

      The next 2 hours or so consisted of you getting your ass kicked once again. You stood opposite of Jungkook, waiting for him to charge at you, giving it one more try. “Alright.. 3..2..” He began yet again, running full speed once he hit 1. 

You quickly tried to register the words he told you earlier, but it all slipped from your memory as he charged, aiming and successfully slicing down your upper arm. You let out a strong hiss and swung around at him before your yell startled him.

        “Fuck this! I’m done! I quit!” You screamed out, dropping your weapon to the floor and kicking it away from you. “Y/N…You-“ “No! No Jungkook! I’m done! I’m not strong enough I can’t do this!” You yelled out, throwing your hands in the air. 

“I’m too weak..” You mumbled as you quickly stormed off towards the door, causing Jungkook to grab at your non-injured forearm. “Wait.. you’re bleeding..” “So what..” You quickly yanked your arm out of his reach and slammed the door as you left.

     Sitting up against a tree nearby, you finally let yourself collapse. Tears no longer brimming your eyes, but falling freely now. Small sniffles accompanying. Your arm stung like a bitch at the moment but you didn’t care anymore.

“I can’t do this..” You cried to yourself as you leaned your head against the base of the tree. “I’m too weak…” You continued to weep as you wiped at your eyes and nose.

       Was it all worth it anymore? Surely you couldn’t do this. You weren’t made for this life… but neither was Jungkook.. and you saw that. But he still manages and found a way to survive. You never gave him credit for it, but now that you experienced it first hand, he was so strong. Much stronger than you could ever and will ever be.

    You just missed the simpler times. Working at that shitty motel.. Your biggest worry being school and not dying at any given moment.. You missed your friends… Family… Minji..

         To be completely honest, you tried to just erase it from your memories. You weren’t strong enough, or at least not yet to face it and face reality. 

The reality of her being dead, her body still laying there back at Taehyung’s old base.. dying at the hands of him.. You thought surely it would’ve been all fine.. Jungkook was there.. he promised to get you out, but that didn’t mean anything for Minji you guessed.

        You still vividly remembered the look on her face when she first woke and saw you back at Taehyung’s. You wished you were dead in that moment because it would’ve been better than trying to explain the hell you’ve gone through and now just involved her in.

       To be honest, still to this moment you wished you would’ve. You wished it was you who Taehyung killed. You wished it wouldn’t have been you who made it out amongst all the chaos you faced inside those walls. You wished it wasn’t you who Jaebum sacrificed himself for. 

You wished it wasn’t you who brought Jin face to face with death. You wished it wasn’t you who cost a whole army their lives outside of Taehyung’s base. You wished it wasn’t you who Jungkook saved. You wished it wasn’t you who Jungkook met.

      You finally begun dragging yourself back inside when the sun had managed to make its way down. Wiping away the tears that lingered on your face and brushing off the dirt and grass. You headed back for the backdoor you left unlocked when you left earlier. 

Stepping back inside, you noticed Jungkook wasn’t in the living room and decided he was probably still downstairs in the practice room or something. You didn’t really care at the moment in all honesty.

     Trudging up the stairs, you made your way down the hall to the bathroom. Flipping the light switch on as you opened the door, you stepped in, closing the door behind you. Y

ou immediately walked over to the cabinet, pulling the small door open and taking out the first aid kit.

    You set the small box down on the counter and reached for a small washcloth, running it under warm water and then wiping gently at your arm. You let out a small hiss as the cloth came into contact with your wound. You watched as the cloth slowly became a dark red as the blood left your skin.

       Grabbing a small amount of ointment and applying it over the cut, you grabbed a bandage and wrapped it around your arm, struggling to secure it at the end. 

Letting out a grunt and gripping the end tightly, you finally pulled the bandage tight and secured it. You headed back towards the door, flipping off the light and heading to yours and Jungkook’s shared room.

       Turning the knob with ease, you pushed the door open and let it close halfway behind you. You walked over and sat at the edge of the bed and began to untie your shoes. 

Tossing them in the corner of the room, and then changing into some leggings and a shirt. You ran a hand through your hair and went and sat back at the edge of the bed.

    Scanning around the room a few times, there was still no sign of Jungkook. It felt somewhat weird you had to admit not being with him 24/7, but you figured you could use the hour or 2 away from each other. 

Glancing over at his side of the bed, you noticed he had a pack of cigarettes and a lighter on the nightstand. Figuring it couldn’t do much harm to you anymore, you let your misery get the best of you and decided to have one.

 Pulling the balcony door open, you grabbed the pack of cigarettes and lighter and stepped out.

      Taking the small object in between your two fingers, you guided it up to your mouth and took a long drag, before exhaling and blowing the white smoke back into the air. 

It tasted like shit and left your mouth feeling dry, but there was something oddly comforting and therapeutic about it. You could see why Jungkook did it almost every night.

     Speaking of which, as you went back to take another drag, you could hear footsteps approaching the bedroom followed by Jungkook calling out your name. “Y/N..?” He called out, as he slowly pushed the bedroom door open. 

“Y/N are you alright..?” Jungkook asked as he neared the balcony, wondering what you were doing outside.

        It wasn’t til he got closer he saw what was going on. You turned, cigarette in hand, about to answer, but got cut off abruptly. “Are you joking?” Jungkook scolded as he quickly walked out onto the balcony, smacking the cigarette out of your hand.

“What the hell do you think you’re doing?!” He scolded as he snatched the pack and lighter from the small table beside you. 

“What does it look like.. or should I say what did it look like..” You huffed back, crossing your arms over your chest. “These things aren’t good for you. They’ll kill you.” Jungkook glared at you as he shoved the pack in his back pocket. 

“Okay dad…” You snapped, turning your back to him. “Why do you do it then huh? I’m not a damn baby Jungkook. I can do whatever I want.” You growl at him.

       Jungkook snapped, grabbing your wrist and twirling you around to face him. “What’s wrong with you? Why are you acting like this all of a sudden?” Jungkook furrowed his brows as he clutched your wrist. 

“You know what’s wrong..” You mumbled as you yanked your wrist free, walking back inside your room, Jungkook following hot on your trail. 

“You already know I wouldn’t be doing this if I didn’t think it was what’s best for you Y/N. What’s best for us.” Jungkook pleaded as he grabbed your wrist once more, dragging you over to sit on the bed with him.

       “I love you Y/N. You know I do. I just want you to be strong. To be able to protect yourself if I’m not there.” You let your hair fall in front of your eyes, not daring to face him. “But that’s the thing Jungkook. I’m not strong. You again of all people should know that.” You mumbled the last part.

ou immediately walked over to the cabinet, pulling the small door open and taking out the first aid kit.

“What does it look like.. or should I say what did it look like..” You huffed back, crossing your arms over your chest. “These things aren’t good for you. They’ll kill you.” Jungkook glared at you as he shoved the pack in his back pocket.

“You know what’s wrong..” You mumbled as you yanked your wrist free, walking back inside your room, Jungkook following hot on your trail.

The sooner the better..” Namjoon stood from his desk, getting ready to call in for a meeting on the new plan. 

“Good luck.. Don’t forget you’re doing this for her..” Namjoon asserted before hanging up abruptly.

How was he going to explain to you? What would you say or do? Jungkook ran his hands through his hair once more trying to settle his nerves as he began to make breakfast for you two, deciding that would be the best time to break the news..

You stirred around a few times, groaning as you slowly began to wake up. The light coming through the curtains was bright enough to cause you to rub at your eyes, shielding them from the sensitive rays. 

“Shit..” You mumbled as you began to come to your senses. You pried your eyes open, taking in your surroundings and position when you realized what had just happened. You slept with Jungkook.

Pulling a plain white shirt over your head and changing into underwear, you decided you looked decent enough, considering it was still early morning and you weren’t planning to go anywhere anytime soon. 

Only then, as you ran your hands through your hair in an attempt to smooth the frizzy hairs, you realized Jungkook wasn’t anywhere to be seen.

You furrowed your brows and quickly moved over to his side of the bed to see his phone was gone along with his sweatpants. 

Thinking maybe he just went to the bathroom, you began to make your way towards the door to the hallway, when the smell of eggs and bacon hit your nose.

Making your way down the hallway to the stairs, the aroma of the fresh food became stronger. Figuring it was Jungkook, you tried to quickly make your way down the stairs, but failed as your legs felt like jelly. Your face became another shade of light red as your mind kept wandering back to why and how your legs came to be in the state they are.

You let a small smile form on your face, imagining all the mornings you two would share like this.. Making breakfast together, enjoying coffee and such.. Minus the pain in the legs..

“Fuck!” You yelled out as your back hit the mat once again. “You keep dropping your shoulder too low Y/N.. You need to react faster than that..” Jungkook explained as he landed on top of you, with your arm pulled back.

You never gave him credit for it, but now that you experienced it first hand, he was so strong. Much stronger than you could ever and will ever be.

You wished it wasn’t you who brought Jin face to face with death. You wished it wasn’t you who cost a whole army their lives outside of Taehyung’s base. You wished it wasn’t you who Jungkook saved. You wished it wasn’t you who Jungkook met.

     Trudging up the stairs, you made your way down the hall to the bathroom. Flipping the light switch on as you opened the door, you stepped in, closing the door behind you. Y

ou immediately walked over to the cabinet, pulling the small door open and taking out the first aid kit.

       Grabbing a small amount of ointment and applying it over the cut, you grabbed a bandage and wrapped it around your arm, struggling to secure it at the end. 

Letting out a grunt and gripping the end tightly, you finally pulled the bandage tight and secured it. You headed back towards the door, flipping off the light and heading to yours and Jungkook’s shared room.

       Turning the knob with ease, you pushed the door open and let it close halfway behind you. You walked over and sat at the edge of the bed and began to untie your shoes.

      Taking the small object in between your two fingers, you guided it up to your mouth and took a long drag, before exhaling and blowing the white smoke back into the air. 

It tasted like shit and left your mouth feeling dry, but there was something oddly comforting and therapeutic about it. You could see why Jungkook did it almost every night.

     Speaking of which, as you went back to take another drag, you could hear footsteps approaching the bedroom followed by Jungkook calling out your name. “Y/N..?” He called out, as he slowly pushed the bedroom door open. 

“Y/N are you alright..?” Jungkook asked as he neared the balcony, wondering what you were doing outside.

        It wasn’t til he got closer he saw what was going on. You turned, cigarette in hand, about to answer, but got cut off abruptly. “Are you joking?” Jungkook scolded as he quickly walked out onto the balcony, smacking the cigarette out of your hand.

“What the hell do you think you’re doing?!” He scolded as he snatched the pack and lighter from the small table beside you. 

“What does it look like.. or should I say what did it look like..” You huffed back, crossing your arms over your chest. “These things aren’t good for you. They’ll kill you.” Jungkook glared at you as he shoved the pack in his back pocket. 

“Okay dad…” You snapped, turning your back to him. “Why do you do it then huh? I’m not a damn baby Jungkook. I can do whatever I want.” You growl at him.

       Jungkook snapped, grabbing your wrist and twirling you around to face him. “What’s wrong with you? Why are you acting like this all of a sudden?” Jungkook furrowed his brows as he clutched your wrist. 

“You know what’s wrong..” You mumbled as you yanked your wrist free, walking back inside your room, Jungkook following hot on your trail. 

“You already know I wouldn’t be doing this if I didn’t think it was what’s best for you Y/N. What’s best for us.” Jungkook pleaded as he grabbed your wrist once more, dragging you over to sit on the bed with him.

       “I love you Y/N. You know I do. I just want you to be strong. To be able to protect yourself if I’m not there.” You let your hair fall in front of your eyes, not daring to face him. “But that’s the thing Jungkook. I’m not strong. You again of all people should know that.” You mumbled the last part.

        “But you are strong.” Jungkook immediately fires back, taking your face in his hands.

“Just trust me Y/N please..” He said placing his forehead against yours. 

“I..” You began, but paused when the sound of car pulling up outside startled you both. “Who’s - ..?”         

      “Y/N kill the lights.. now.”

-  2 weeks later   -

“Fuck!” You yelled out as your back hit the mat once again. “You keep dropping your shoulder too low Y/N.. You need to react faster than that..” Jungkook explained as he landed on top of you, with your arm pulled back. 

“I’m fucking trying Jungkook.. Maybe if this wasn’t so rushed I could learn properly..” You snapped back at him as you stood, brushing off your arms. 

You had been thrown down on the mat a good 6 times in a row now, not understanding the mistake being made. Namjoon had called back last week informing Jungkook that we had 2 weeks left to train before they had to bring you into base.

“I know it’s hard.. But this is the only way you’ll get better.” Jungkook explained as he walked over behind you. “Look, you have your shoulder here by the time I’m already within reach. It needs to be here, so you can reach my arm and then flip.” Jungkook instructed as he placed his hands on your shoulder, turning your body. 

“Try it from that angle next time.” Jungkook patted your back as he moved to stand in front of you.

             “Alright..” You breathed out, rolling your shoulders back. “I’m ready.” You announced. Jungkook nodded, giving a countdown. “Alright… 3..2..” He breathed out as he then ran at you, pulling the same move as last time. 

Remembering the tip Jungkook gave you, you moved your shoulder to the right instead, grabbing Jungkook’s arm and twisting it to pull him around. 

Thinking you finally did it and had the upperhand, you began to ease into it, until Jungkook thrashed and turned his body, landing a strike to your jaw. Of course it didn’t hurt really bad, but still enough to piss you off even more.

“The hell was that?!” You huffed, shoving him away from you. “You let your guard down.” He simply responded. “Never let your guard down until the enemy is down or dead.” He clarified. You just glared at him from your spot on the floor. 

“Take 5 and then we’ll start weapon combat instead.” Jungkook explained as he walked over to the wall, grabbing his water bottle. You pushed yourself up off the floor and out of the room to the bathroom, letting the door slam behind you.

Standing in front of the mirror, you cupped some cold water from the sink and splashed it on your face. Letting the water droplets run off and fall back into the sink. Your face was red and sweaty in defeat. 

Grabbing one of the small towels from the rack, you wiped at your face, wiping away the small hair strands that had stuck to your face in the process.

 “Shit..” You mumbled as you turned to see a small purple bruise forming on your jaw from where Jungkook struck you. You really wished at times like these you would’ve just said no and stuck with it.

          Walking back into the large practice room, you saw Jungkook leaned up against the wall, phone in hand, typing away. You just scoffed and proceeded to place your belongings back onto the floor and stand in the middle of the room. However, you noticed Jungkook pulled out a small cart with all sorts of pocket knives and sharp weapons. 

“You done…?” You sarcastically commented as he looked up from his phone before hitting the screen once more and pocketing it. “Yeah, sorry.” He dismissed as he wheeled the cart over towards you.

         “Pick one.” He abruptly commented as the cart came to a stop. “This again?” You dreaded. Last time you failed miserably and left with all sorts of small cuts and lacerations. 

Jungkook was ruthless during training but afterwards always seemed to make it up and baby you. You wondered why he even bothered to go so hard in the first place.

        “Yeah. You need to get better. This is gonna be the majority of what you run into out there.” Jungkook explained as he picked up a decent sized dagger. You scoffer once more, picking up a similar weapon before kicking the cart to the side. “Alright, let’s try the chokehold again.” Jungkook announced. You immediately frowned.

            “Really..? Don’t you think we did that enough? You know I suck Jungkook.” You pulled down the collar of your shirt, revealing all sorts of small cuts along your collarbones and base of your neck.

 “That’s why we need to train and keep working on it Y/N…” Jungkook whined and tossed his head back, having had this conversation plenty times before. “Just follow my lead again..”

      The next 2 hours or so consisted of you getting your ass kicked once again. You stood opposite of Jungkook, waiting for him to charge at you, giving it one more try. “Alright.. 3..2..” He began yet again, running full speed once he hit 1. 

You quickly tried to register the words he told you earlier, but it all slipped from your memory as he charged, aiming and successfully slicing down your upper arm. You let out a strong hiss and swung around at him before your yell startled him.

        “Fuck this! I’m done! I quit!” You screamed out, dropping your weapon to the floor and kicking it away from you. “Y/N…You-“ “No! No Jungkook! I’m done! I’m not strong enough I can’t do this!” You yelled out, throwing your hands in the air. 

“I’m too weak..” You mumbled as you quickly stormed off towards the door, causing Jungkook to grab at your non-injured forearm. “Wait.. you’re bleeding..” “So what..” You quickly yanked your arm out of his reach and slammed the door as you left.

     Sitting up against a tree nearby, you finally let yourself collapse. Tears no longer brimming your eyes, but falling freely now. Small sniffles accompanying. Your arm stung like a bitch at the moment but you didn’t care anymore.

“I can’t do this..” You cried to yourself as you leaned your head against the base of the tree. “I’m too weak…” You continued to weep as you wiped at your eyes and nose.

       Was it all worth it anymore? Surely you couldn’t do this. You weren’t made for this life… but neither was Jungkook.. and you saw that. But he still manages and found a way to survive. You never gave him credit for it, but now that you experienced it first hand, he was so strong. Much stronger than you could ever and will ever be.

    You just missed the simpler times. Working at that shitty motel.. Your biggest worry being school and not dying at any given moment.. You missed your friends… Family… Minji..

         To be completely honest, you tried to just erase it from your memories. You weren’t strong enough, or at least not yet to face it and face reality. 

The reality of her being dead, her body still laying there back at Taehyung’s old base.. dying at the hands of him.. You thought surely it would’ve been all fine.. Jungkook was there.. he promised to get you out, but that didn’t mean anything for Minji you guessed.

        You still vividly remembered the look on her face when she first woke and saw you back at Taehyung’s. You wished you were dead in that moment because it would’ve been better than trying to explain the hell you’ve gone through and now just involved her in.

       To be honest, still to this moment you wished you would’ve. You wished it was you who Taehyung killed. You wished it wouldn’t have been you who made it out amongst all the chaos you faced inside those walls. You wished it wasn’t you who Jaebum sacrificed himself for. 

You wished it wasn’t you who brought Jin face to face with death. You wished it wasn’t you who cost a whole army their lives outside of Taehyung’s base. You wished it wasn’t you who Jungkook saved. You wished it wasn’t you who Jungkook met.

      You finally begun dragging yourself back inside when the sun had managed to make its way down. Wiping away the tears that lingered on your face and brushing off the dirt and grass. You headed back for the backdoor you left unlocked when you left earlier. 

Stepping back inside, you noticed Jungkook wasn’t in the living room and decided he was probably still downstairs in the practice room or something. You didn’t really care at the moment in all honesty.

     Trudging up the stairs, you made your way down the hall to the bathroom. Flipping the light switch on as you opened the door, you stepped in, closing the door behind you. Y

ou immediately walked over to the cabinet, pulling the small door open and taking out the first aid kit.

    You set the small box down on the counter and reached for a small washcloth, running it under warm water and then wiping gently at your arm. You let out a small hiss as the cloth came into contact with your wound. You watched as the cloth slowly became a dark red as the blood left your skin.

       Grabbing a small amount of ointment and applying it over the cut, you grabbed a bandage and wrapped it around your arm, struggling to secure it at the end. 

Letting out a grunt and gripping the end tightly, you finally pulled the bandage tight and secured it. You headed back towards the door, flipping off the light and heading to yours and Jungkook’s shared room.

       Turning the knob with ease, you pushed the door open and let it close halfway behind you. You walked over and sat at the edge of the bed and began to untie your shoes. 

Tossing them in the corner of the room, and then changing into some leggings and a shirt. You ran a hand through your hair and went and sat back at the edge of the bed.

    Scanning around the room a few times, there was still no sign of Jungkook. It felt somewhat weird you had to admit not being with him 24/7, but you figured you could use the hour or 2 away from each other. 

Glancing over at his side of the bed, you noticed he had a pack of cigarettes and a lighter on the nightstand. Figuring it couldn’t do much harm to you anymore, you let your misery get the best of you and decided to have one.

 Pulling the balcony door open, you grabbed the pack of cigarettes and lighter and stepped out.

      Taking the small object in between your two fingers, you guided it up to your mouth and took a long drag, before exhaling and blowing the white smoke back into the air. 

It tasted like shit and left your mouth feeling dry, but there was something oddly comforting and therapeutic about it. You could see why Jungkook did it almost every night.

     Speaking of which, as you went back to take another drag, you could hear footsteps approaching the bedroom followed by Jungkook calling out your name. “Y/N..?” He called out, as he slowly pushed the bedroom door open. 

“Y/N are you alright..?” Jungkook asked as he neared the balcony, wondering what you were doing outside.

        It wasn’t til he got closer he saw what was going on. You turned, cigarette in hand, about to answer, but got cut off abruptly. “Are you joking?” Jungkook scolded as he quickly walked out onto the balcony, smacking the cigarette out of your hand.

“What the hell do you think you’re doing?!” He scolded as he snatched the pack and lighter from the small table beside you. 

“What does it look like.. or should I say what did it look like..” You huffed back, crossing your arms over your chest. “These things aren’t good for you. They’ll kill you.” Jungkook glared at you as he shoved the pack in his back pocket. 

“Okay dad…” You snapped, turning your back to him. “Why do you do it then huh? I’m not a damn baby Jungkook. I can do whatever I want.” You growl at him.

       Jungkook snapped, grabbing your wrist and twirling you around to face him. “What’s wrong with you? Why are you acting like this all of a sudden?” Jungkook furrowed his brows as he clutched your wrist. 

“You know what’s wrong..” You mumbled as you yanked your wrist free, walking back inside your room, Jungkook following hot on your trail. 

“You already know I wouldn’t be doing this if I didn’t think it was what’s best for you Y/N. What’s best for us.” Jungkook pleaded as he grabbed your wrist once more, dragging you over to sit on the bed with him.

       “I love you Y/N. You know I do. I just want you to be strong. To be able to protect yourself if I’m not there.” You let your hair fall in front of your eyes, not daring to face him. “But that’s the thing Jungkook. I’m not strong. You again of all people should know that.” You mumbled the last part.

        “But you are strong.” Jungkook immediately fires back, taking your face in his hands. 

“Maybe you don’t see it, but you’ve been through hell and back and you’re still here. You’re still my girl. And if I thought even for a second that this training and plan would be of no good or bring harm to you, you know I wouldn’t have done it.” Jungkook brushed his thumb against your cheek. 

“Just trust me Y/N please..” He said placing his forehead against yours. 

“I..” You began, but paused when the sound of car pulling up outside startled you both. “Who’s - ..?”         

      “Y/N kill the lights.. now.”
